greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Plane partition triangle, row sums = A000219; derived from the Euler transform of [1, 2, 3,...].
comment: Row sums = A000219, number of planar partitions of n starting with offset 1. /Q (1, 3, 6, 13, 24, 48,...).
formula: Construct an array with rows = a, a*b, a*b*c,...; where a = [1, 1, 1,...], b = [1, 0, 2, 0, 3,...], c = [1, 0, 0, 3, 0, 0, 6,...], d = [1, 0, 0, 0, 4, 0, 0, 0, 10, 0, 0, 0, 20,...]...;etc, where rows converge to A000219: (1, 1, 3, 6, 13, 24,...). The triangle = finite differences of column terms starting from the top.
example: First few rows of the array =
...then taking finite differences from the top and discarding the first "1" /Q we obtain:
